strategic_overview.purpose: Enable employees to request company-approved devices (notebooks and phones) through a self-service Power App, triggering approval workflows and integrating with internal policies.

mvp_components.app_details: Allows employees to browse available devices, view specs, photos, availability, and filter by department-approved models. Allows employees to select a device, justify business need, select urgency level, and auto-populate employee name/department from Azure AD.

app_screens.screen_details: View specs, photos, and availability of selected device.

features.feat_0009: Responsive Layout for Different Screen Sizes
features.feat_0013: Auto-population of Employee Details from Azure AD
features.feat_0014: Real-time Data Refresh for Availability Status

app_screens.screen_details: Select a device from the catalog.
Input business need and urgency level.
Auto-populate employee details from Azure AD.

features.feat_0008: Navigation Controls to Move to Next Screen
features.feat_0010: Responsive Design for Different Device Access
features.feat_0011: Consistent Branding with Company Themes and Logos
features.feat_0013: Error Handling for Directory Lookup Failures
features.feat_0014: Loading Indicators for Data Retrieval Processes
features.feat_0016: Save Progress Option for Multi-step Form

mvp_components.flow_details: Managers receive approval notifications and can approve/reject requests with comments within a 2 business day SLA.

flow_actions.action_details: Manager receives a notification for approval.
Manager approves or rejects the request with comments.

mvp_components.trigger: When an item is created or modified in SharePoint

post_mvp_modules.details: Allows employees to view the status of their orders and receive email notifications at each step. Optional Power BI dashboard for tracking.
post_mvp_modules.recommendation: Extend the Order Request Form with a new screen for tracking to provide a seamless experience within the same app.

post_mvp_modules.details: Allows IT Administrators to update stock levels, mark orders as fulfilled, and link to the procurement system.
post_mvp_modules.recommendation: Extend the Device Catalog app with new screens for inventory management to centralize device-related functionalities.

constraints: Must use Power Apps Canvas App
Data must be stored in Dataverse
Approval process must use Power Automate
Device models filtered by department policy
App must support desktop + mobile usage
No external users (internal only via Azure AD)
integration_points: Power Automate for approvals and notifications
strategic_overview.notes: Design should be clean and corporate with responsive layout for phone and desktop. Use dropdowns, cards, and status icons. Ensure accessible design (WCAG AA).

fields.name: EmployeeID
fields.description: ID of the employee who placed the order

fields.name: Justification
fields.description: Business justification provided by the employee

database_model.notes: The Employees table and Devices table are related to the Orders table through foreign keys. This allows us to track which employee ordered which device. The normalization of the database ensures that there is no redundant data and that each piece of data is stored in its most logical place.
